comments.author: Xiaolu @ 6 Bittersweets
comments.content: I usually avoid fried foods but who can resist a fresh, homemade doughnut?  These look absolutely delicious, and I can't wait to try the recipes from Lara's book myself.

comments.author: molahs
comments.content:
We just got the doughnut cookbook and our first attempt was fabulous. Who knew that vegan doughnuts could be so simple and delicious?

Mmmmmm. Doughnuts.

comments.author: alessandra@clear.net.nz
comments.content:
geee, these look yummy! Happy Hanukkah!

ciao
Alessandra

comments.author: Rivki locker (Ordinary Blogger)
comments.content: Funny, I just blogged a similar recipe yesterday! We top ours with cinnamon sugar mix. The plate was licked clean!

comments.author: Kathryn Hutchison
comments.content: These look delicious. What kind of oil did you use to deep fry them, and how big was the pot you used?  I'm a deep frying rookie, but I'd like to try to make these.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Kathryn - I often use the Spectrum Organics "High Heat" Canola Oil when I deep fry, but any fully refined oil whose smoke point is over say 380 will be fine. I think I used a pot that is about 8 inches in diameter and could fry 4 bunuelos at a time.

comments.author: Marcea
comments.content: Thanks so much for sharing this.. my Diary and egg allergic daughter will be thrilled to finally have a donut! I will make it this weekend.

comments.author: JP @ Fat Loss Blogger
comments.content:
Man, these things look delicious Michael!

I've completely sworn off doughnuts, but reading this post has me in a cold sweat. Must... resist.

comments.author: Naomie
comments.content:
This looks amazing, I wonder can I replace flour with a gluten free all purpose mix? If so any ideas of which? I'd really love some of these yummy yummy doughnuts.
Thanks
